moves.1. d4 d5 2. Bf4 e6 3. Nf3 f6: Interesting option, but it provides me with a clear target: Qh5+, sac and mate.
moves.4. Nbd2 Bd6 5. e3 Bxf4 6. exf4 Nc6 7. Nh: Here it goes. I don't care if he takes the d4 pawn.
moves.7... Nge7: He doesn't, so I protect my d4 pawn.
moves.9. Bd3: I add another piece to be sacced on g6.
moves.9... b6: This time he doesn't see it.
moves.10. Qh5+ Kd7: Still, it's not so easy to break in.
moves.11... g6 12. O-O-O: Bringing more material to attack the e6 pawn with rooks.
moves.12... Bb7 13. Rhe1 f5 14. Qf3: ? Qe2 was more straight-forward. If he defends with Qg8, his pieces are completely tangled.
moves.14... Qg8 15. Re2: Re3 was better: when creating an Alekine's gun, the queen needs to be in the last place, ideally.
moves.18... Nec6 19. Ng5 Bc8: Well, so this is "the unbreakable defence" against "the most powerful attack". If c4, Nb4... so I probably should have played a3.
moves.20. Nb3: Just a bad move: he can expand with a5-a4.
moves.20... h6 21. Nf3 Qf7 22. Ne5 Nxe5 23. Qx: With tempo on the rook, but this is not very useful...
moves.26... a5: ...which he prevents. I'm coductig this attack very badly, being my idea to create a sort of zugswang for black at some point.
moves.27. Bb5 Re7 28. Qd3: Rebuilding my Alekine's gun with the Q in the middle.
moves.28... Bd7: BxN+ at some point will force him to take with the K, after which I could bring my  Q to b5... but even this is not a clear plan. I have to push c4, this is the break that will give me the game.
moves.29. Re2e3 Qf6 30. Qe2 Qxh4: Well, his Q is not defending, so I can go on with my plan.
moves.31. Bxc6+ Kxc6 32. c4: ? g3 must have been played first.
moves.32... Qxf4 33. cxd5+ exd5: ...now my R is pinned. But I'll attack the other way.
moves.34. Qb5+ Kb7 35. Nc5+: Finally a good move: once the B is removed, the game is mine.
moves.37... Qxd4: Now, Re8+ can be answered with Kb7. Still, after that, RxR, KxR, Re8+ wins. But I found...
moves.38. Qc6: ...and NOW this is over. There is no defence against Re8+. Thanks for reading .
